017package org.tribuo.classification.example;
018
019import com.oracle.labs.mlrg.olcut.util.Pair;
020import org.tribuo.Dataset;
021import org.tribuo.Example;
022import org.tribuo.MutableDataset;
023import org.tribuo.classification.Label;
024import org.tribuo.classification.LabelFactory;
025import org.tribuo.impl.ArrayExample;
026import org.tribuo.provenance.DataSourceProvenance;
027import org.tribuo.provenance.SimpleDataSourceProvenance;
028
029import java.time.OffsetDateTime;
030
031/**
032 * Generates three example train and test datasets, used for unit testing.
033 * They don't necessarily have sensible classification boundaries,
034 * it's for testing the machinery rather than accuracy.
035 */
036public final class LabelledDataGenerator {
037
038    // final class with private constructor to ensure it's not instantiated.
039    private LabelledDataGenerator() {}
040
041    private static final LabelFactory labelFactory = new LabelFactory();
042
043    public static Pair<Dataset<Label>,Dataset<Label>> denseTrainTest() {
044        return denseTrainTest(-1.0);
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Generates a train/test dataset pair which is dense in the features,
049     * each example has 4 features,{A,B,C,D}, and there are 4 classes,
050     * {Foo,Bar,Baz,Quux}.
051     * @param negate Supply -1.0 to insert some negative values into the dataset.
052     * @return A pair of datasets.
053     */
054    public static Pair<Dataset<Label>,Dataset<Label>> denseTrainTest(double negate) {
055        DataSourceProvenance provenance = new SimpleDataSourceProvenance("TrainingData", OffsetDateTime.now(),labelFactory);
056        MutableDataset<Label> train = new MutableDataset<>(provenance,labelFactory);
057
058        String[] names = new String[]{"A","B","C","D"};
059        double[] values = new double[]{1.0,0.5,1.0,negate*1.0};
060        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
061        values = new double[]{1.5,0.35,1.3,negate*1.2};
062        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names.clone(),values));
063        values = new double[]{1.2,0.45,1.5,negate*1.0};
064        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names.clone(),values));
065
066        values = new double[]{negate*1.1,0.55,negate*1.5,0.5};
067        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names.clone(),values));
068        values = new double[]{negate*1.5,0.25,negate*1,0.125};
069        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names.clone(),values));
070        values = new double[]{negate*1,0.5,negate*1.123,0.123};
071        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names.clone(),values));
072
073        values = new double[]{1.5,5.0,0.5,4.5};
074        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names.clone(),values));
075        values = new double[]{1.234,5.1235,0.1235,6.0};
076        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names.clone(),values));
077        values = new double[]{1.734,4.5,0.5123,5.5};
078        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names.clone(),values));
079
080        values = new double[]{negate*1,0.25,5,10.0};
081        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names.clone(),values));
082        values = new double[]{negate*1.4,0.55,5.65,12.0};
083        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names.clone(),values));
084        values = new double[]{negate*1.9,0.25,5.9,15};
085        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names.clone(),values));
086
087        DataSourceProvenance testProvenance = new SimpleDataSourceProvenance("TestingData", OffsetDateTime.now(),labelFactory);
088        MutableDataset<Label> test = new MutableDataset<>(testProvenance,labelFactory);
089
090        values = new double[]{2.0,0.45,3.5,negate*2.0};
091        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names.clone(),values));
092        values = new double[]{negate*2.0,0.55,negate*2.5,2.5};
093        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names.clone(),values));
094        values = new double[]{1.75,5.0,1.0,6.5};
095        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names.clone(),values));
096        values = new double[]{negate*1.5,0.25,5.0,20.0};
097        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names.clone(),values));
098
099        return new Pair<>(train,test);
100    }
101
102    public static Pair<Dataset<Label>,Dataset<Label>> sparseTrainTest() {
103        return sparseTrainTest(-1.0);
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Generates a pair of datasets, where the features are sparse,
108     * and unknown features appear in the test data. It has the same
109     * 4 classes {Foo,Bar,Baz,Quux}.
110     * @param negate Supply -1.0 to negate some values in this dataset.
111     * @return A pair of train and test datasets.
112     */
113    public static Pair<Dataset<Label>,Dataset<Label>> sparseTrainTest(double negate) {
114        DataSourceProvenance provenance = new SimpleDataSourceProvenance("TrainingData", OffsetDateTime.now(),labelFactory);
115        MutableDataset<Label> train = new MutableDataset<>(provenance,labelFactory);
116
117        String[] names = new String[]{"A","B","C","D"};
118        double[] values = new double[]{1.0,0.5,1.0,negate*1.0};
119        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
120        names = new String[]{"B","D","F","H"};
121        values = new double[]{1.5,0.35,1.3,negate*1.2};
122        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
123        names = new String[]{"A","J","D","M"};
124        values = new double[]{1.2,0.45,1.5,negate*1.0};
125        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
126
127        names = new String[]{"C","E","F","H"};
128        values = new double[]{negate*1.1,0.55,negate*1.5,0.5};
129        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
130        names = new String[]{"E","G","F","I"};
131        values = new double[]{negate*1.5,0.25,negate*1,0.125};
132        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
133        names = new String[]{"J","K","C","E"};
134        values = new double[]{negate*1,0.5,negate*1.123,0.123};
135        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
136
137        names = new String[]{"E","A","K","J"};
138        values = new double[]{1.5,5.0,0.5,4.5};
139        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names,values));
140        names = new String[]{"B","C","E","H"};
141        values = new double[]{1.234,5.1235,0.1235,6.0};
142        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names,values));
143        names = new String[]{"A","M","I","J"};
144        values = new double[]{1.734,4.5,0.5123,5.5};
145        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names,values));
146
147        names = new String[]{"Z","A","B","C"};
148        values = new double[]{negate*1,0.25,5,10.0};
149        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names,values));
150        names = new String[]{"K","V","E","D"};
151        values = new double[]{negate*1.4,0.55,5.65,12.0};
152        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names,values));
153        names = new String[]{"B","G","E","A"};
154        values = new double[]{negate*1.9,0.25,5.9,15};
155        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names,values));
156
157        DataSourceProvenance testProvenance = new SimpleDataSourceProvenance("TestingData", OffsetDateTime.now(),labelFactory);
158        MutableDataset<Label> test = new MutableDataset<>(testProvenance,labelFactory);
159
160        names = new String[]{"AA","B","C","D"};
161        values = new double[]{2.0,0.45,3.5,negate*2.0};
162        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
163        names = new String[]{"B","BB","F","E"};
164        values = new double[]{negate*2.0,0.55,negate*2.5,2.5};
165        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
166        names = new String[]{"B","E","G","H"};
167        values = new double[]{1.75,5.0,1.0,6.5};
168        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Baz"),names,values));
169        names = new String[]{"B","CC","DD","EE"};
170        values = new double[]{negate*1.5,0.25,5.0,20.0};
171        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Quux"),names,values));
172
173        return new Pair<>(train,test);
174    }
175
176    public static Pair<Dataset<Label>,Dataset<Label>> binarySparseTrainTest() {
177        return binarySparseTrainTest(-1.0);
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Generates a pair of datasets with sparse features and unknown features
182     * in the test data. Has binary labels {Foo,Bar}.
183     * @param negate Supply -1.0 to negate some values in this dataset.
184     * @return A pair of train and test datasets.
185     */
186    public static Pair<Dataset<Label>,Dataset<Label>> binarySparseTrainTest(double negate) {
187        DataSourceProvenance provenance = new SimpleDataSourceProvenance("TrainingData", OffsetDateTime.now(),labelFactory);
188        MutableDataset<Label> train = new MutableDataset<>(provenance,labelFactory);
189
190        String[] names = new String[]{"A","B","C","D"};
191        double[] values = new double[]{1.0,0.5,1.0,negate*1.0};
192        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
193        names = new String[]{"B","D","F","H"};
194        values = new double[]{1.5,0.35,1.3,negate*1.2};
195        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
196        names = new String[]{"A","J","D","M"};
197        values = new double[]{1.2,0.45,1.5,negate*1.0};
198        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
199
200        names = new String[]{"C","E","F","H"};
201        values = new double[]{negate*1.1,0.55,negate*1.5,0.5};
202        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
203        names = new String[]{"E","G","F","I"};
204        values = new double[]{negate*1.5,0.25,negate*1,0.125};
205        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
206        names = new String[]{"J","K","C","E"};
207        values = new double[]{negate*1,0.5,negate*1.123,0.123};
208        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
209
210        names = new String[]{"E","A","K","J"};
211        values = new double[]{1.5,5.0,0.5,4.5};
212        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
213        names = new String[]{"B","C","E","H"};
214        values = new double[]{1.234,5.1235,0.1235,6.0};
215        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
216        names = new String[]{"A","M","I","J"};
217        values = new double[]{1.734,4.5,0.5123,5.5};
218        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
219
220        names = new String[]{"Z","A","B","C"};
221        values = new double[]{negate*1,0.25,5,10.0};
222        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
223        names = new String[]{"K","V","E","D"};
224        values = new double[]{negate*1.4,0.55,5.65,12.0};
225        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
226        names = new String[]{"B","G","E","A"};
227        values = new double[]{negate*1.9,0.25,5.9,15};
228        train.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
229
230        DataSourceProvenance testProvenance = new SimpleDataSourceProvenance("TestingData", OffsetDateTime.now(),labelFactory);
231        MutableDataset<Label> test = new MutableDataset<>(testProvenance,labelFactory);
232
233        names = new String[]{"AA","B","C","D"};
234        values = new double[]{2.0,0.45,3.5,negate*2.0};
235        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
236        names = new String[]{"B","BB","F","E"};
237        values = new double[]{negate*2.0,0.55,negate*2.5,2.5};
238        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
239        names = new String[]{"B","E","G","H"};
240        values = new double[]{1.75,5.0,1.0,6.5};
241        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),names,values));
242        names = new String[]{"B","CC","DD","EE"};
243        values = new double[]{negate*1.5,0.25,5.0,20.0};
244        test.add(new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Bar"),names,values));
245
246        return new Pair<>(train,test);
247    }
248
249    /**
250     * Generates an example with the feature ids 1,5,8, which does not intersect with the
251     * ids used elsewhere in this class. This should make the example empty at prediction time.
252     * @return An example with features {1:1.0,5:5.0,8:8.0}.
253     */
254    public static Example<Label> invalidSparseExample() {
255        return new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),new String[]{"1","5","8"},new double[]{1.0,5.0,8.0});
256    }
257
258    /**
259     * Generates an example with no features.
260     * @return An example with no features.
261     */
262    public static Example<Label> emptyExample() {
263        return new ArrayExample<>(new Label("Foo"),new String[]{},new double[]{});
264    }
265
266}
